long: Meaning: properly, to "scrutinize", i.e. look intently at; hence (with "recognition" implied), to "acknowledge", "be acquainted with", "care for", "respect", "revere", or (with suspicion implied), to "disregard", "ignore", "be strange" toward, "reject", "resign", "dissimulate" (as if ignorant or disowning).  Usage: acknowledge, Ã— could, deliver, discern, dissemble, estrange, feign self to be another, know, take knowledge (notice), perceive, regard, (have) respect, behave (make) self strange(-ly).  Source: a primitive root;
